#summary Where to get the latest source code
#labels Section-Project

The source code is available either as [http://code.google.com/p/remote-testbed/downloads/list?q=label:Type-Archive archives] or using one of the repositories listed below. Generally, the released archives are more stable, but may lack important features and fixes. If you want to keep in sync with the latest source code, tracking one of the repository below is recommended. It also allows you to easily keep track of local changes and makes it easy to contribute code back to the project.

*Google Code SVN Repository*

  The SVN repository hosted by Google Code is not used for day to day development, but serves mainly as an additional and convenient method of distribution. It is periodically [SvnSynchronization synchronized] with one of the [http://git-scm.org/ git] repositories.

  Use this command to anonymously check out the latest project source code:
{{{
svn checkout http://remote-testbed.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ remote-testbed
}}}

  You may also want to _[http://code.google.com/p/remote-testbed/source/browse/trunk browse the code]_, or _[http://code.google.com/p/remote-testbed/source/list view recent changes]_.

*DIKU Repositories*

  The DIKU git [http://repo.or.cz/w/remote.git repositories] are hosted by [http://repo.or.cz/ repo.or.cz], where they can be browsed via gitweb and where you are free to create and host your own "fork" of each of these repositories.

  Use this command to anonymously clone and check out the latest project source code for a given repository:
{{{
git clone git://repo.or.cz/remote/remote-$repo.git
}}}
  Browse the code and view recent changes on the [http://repo.or.cz/w/remote/remote-db.git remote-db], [http://repo.or.cz/w/remote/remote-ws.git remote-ws], [http://repo.or.cz/w/remote/remote-mci.git remote-mci], and [http://repo.or.cz/w/remote/remote-gui.git remote-gui] gitweb pages.


*CIT Repositories*

  Rosta maintains git repositories with CIT specific changes at http://testbed.aws.cit.ie/dev/remote/.

  Use the following command to anonymously clone and check out the latest project source code for a given repository:
{{{
git clone http://testbed.aws.cit.ie/dev/remote/remote-$repo.git
}}}
